item.text: At that time Jeroboam’s son Abijah became sick.

<st data-num="03379" class="">Jeroboam</st> <st data-num="0559" class="">told</st> his <st data-num="0802" class="">wife</st>, “<st data-num="06965 04994 08138">Disguise</st><n id="1" /> yourself so that people <st data-num="03808" class="">cannot</st> <st data-num="03045 03588">recognize</st> <st data-num="0859" class="">you</st> are <st data-num="03379" class="">Jeroboam’</st>s <st data-num="0802" class="">wife</st>. Take 10 loaves of bread, some small cakes, and a container of honey and visit him. He will tell you what will happen to the boy.”
Jeroboam’s wife did as she was told. She went to Shiloh and visited Ahijah. Now Ahijah could not see; he had lost his eyesight in his old age.
But the Lord had told Ahijah, “Look, Jeroboam’s wife is coming to find out from you what will happen to her son, for he is sick. Tell her such and such. When she comes, she will be in a disguise.”

<st data-num="01961" class="">When</st> <st data-num="0281" class="">Ahijah</st> <st data-num="08085" class="">heard</st> the <st data-num="06963" class="">sound</st> of her <st data-num="07272" class="">footsteps</st> as she <st data-num="0935" class="">came</st> through the <st data-num="06607" class="">door</st>, he <st data-num="0559" class="">said</st>, “<st data-num="0935" class="">Come on in</st>, <st data-num="0802" class="">wife</st> of <st data-num="03379" class="">Jeroboam</st>! <st data-num="04100 02088">Why</st> are <st data-num="0859" class="">you</st> <st data-num="05234" class="">pretending to be someone else</st>? <st data-num="0595" class="">I</st> have been <st data-num="07971" class="">commissioned</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> give you <st data-num="07186" class="">bad news</st>.<n id="1" />
Go, tell Jeroboam, ‘This is what the Lord God of Israel has said: “I raised you up from among the people and made you ruler over my people Israel.

I <st data-num="07167" class="">tore</st> the <st data-num="04467" class="">kingdom</st> <st data-num="07167" class="">away</st> from the <st data-num="01732" class="">Davidic</st> <st data-num="01004" class="">dynasty</st> and <st data-num="05414" class="">gave</st> it to you. But you <st data-num="01961" class="">are</st> <st data-num="03808" class="">not</st> like my <st data-num="05650" class="">servant</st> <st data-num="01732" class="">David</st>, <st data-num="0834" class="">who</st> <st data-num="08104" class="">kept</st> my <st data-num="04687" class="">commandments</st> <st data-num="0834" class="">and</st> <st data-num="01980 0310">followed</st> me <st data-num="03605 03824">wholeheartedly</st> by <st data-num="06213" class="">doing</st> <st data-num="07535" class="">only</st> <st data-num="03477" class="">what</st> I <st data-num="05869" class="">approve</st>.<n id="1" />

You have <st data-num="07489 06213">sinned</st> more than <st data-num="03605" class="">all</st> <st data-num="0834" class="">who</st> <st data-num="01961" class="">came</st> <st data-num="06440" class="">before</st> you. You <st data-num="01980" class="">went</st> and <st data-num="03707" class="">angered</st> me by <st data-num="06213" class="">making</st> <st data-num="0312" class="">other</st> <st data-num="0430" class="">gods</st>, <st data-num="04541" class="">formed out of metal</st>; you have <st data-num="07993 0310 01458">completely disregarded</st> me.<n id="1" />

<st data-num="03651" class="">So</st> I am <st data-num="02005" class="">ready</st> to <st data-num="0935" class="">bring</st> <st data-num="07451" class="">disaster</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="0413" class="">on</st> the <st data-num="01004" class="">dynasty</st><n id="2" /> of <st data-num="03379" class="">Jeroboam</st>. I will <st data-num="03772" class="">cut off</st> every last <st data-num="08366 07023">male</st> belonging to <st data-num="03379" class="">Jeroboam</st> in <st data-num="03478" class="">Israel</st>, including even the <st data-num="06113" class="">weak</st> and <st data-num="05800" class="">incapacitated</st>.<n id="3" /> I will <st data-num="01197" class="">burn</st> <st data-num="0310" class="">up</st> the <st data-num="01004" class="">dynasty</st> of <st data-num="03379" class="">Jeroboam</st>, just <st data-num="0834" class="">as</st> one <st data-num="01197" class="">burns</st> <st data-num="01557" class="">manure</st> <st data-num="05704" class="">until</st> it is <st data-num="08552" class="">completely consumed</st>.<n id="4" />
Dogs will eat the members of your family who die in the city, and the birds of the sky will eat the ones who die in the country.”’ Indeed, the Lord has announced it!
“As for you, get up and go home. When you set foot in the city, the boy will die.
All Israel will mourn him and bury him. He is the only one in Jeroboam’s family who will receive a decent burial, for he is the only one in whom the Lord God of Israel found anything good.
The Lord will raise up a king over Israel who will cut off Jeroboam’s dynasty. It is ready to happen!

The Lord will attack Israel, making it like a reed that sways in the water. He will remove Israel from this good land he gave to their ancestors and scatter them beyond the Euphrates River, because they angered the Lord by making Asherah poles.
He will hand Israel over to their enemies because of the sins which Jeroboam committed and which he made Israel commit.”
So Jeroboam’s wife got up and went back to Tirzah. As she crossed the threshold of the house, the boy died.
All Israel buried him and mourned for him, in keeping with the Lord’s message that he had spoken through his servant, the prophet Ahijah.
The rest of the events of Jeroboam’s reign, including the details of his battles and rule, are recorded in the scroll called the Annals of the Kings of Israel.
Jeroboam ruled for 22 years; then he passed away. His son Nadab replaced him as king.

Now Rehoboam son of Solomon ruled in Judah. He was forty-one years old when he became king, and he ruled for 17 years in Jerusalem, the city the Lord chose from all the tribes of Israel to be his home. His mother was an Ammonite woman named Naamah.
Judah did evil in the sight of the Lord. They made him more jealous by their sins than their ancestors had done.

<st data-num="01992" class="">They</st> <st data-num="01571" class="">even</st> <st data-num="01129" class="">built</st> for <st data-num="01992" class="">themselves</st> <st data-num="01116" class="">high places</st>, <st data-num="04676" class="">sacred pillars</st>, and <st data-num="0842" class="">Asherah poles</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">on</st> <st data-num="03605" class="">every</st> <st data-num="01364" class="">high</st> <st data-num="01389" class="">hill</st> and <st data-num="08478" class="">under</st> <st data-num="03605" class="">every</st> <st data-num="07488" class="">green</st> <st data-num="06086" class="">tree</st>.
There were also male cultic prostitutes in the land. They committed the same horrible sins as the nations that the Lord had driven out from before the Israelites.
In King Rehoboam’s fifth year, King Shishak of Egypt attacked Jerusalem.
He took away the treasures of the Lord’s temple and of the royal palace; he took everything, including all the golden shields that Solomon had made.

<st data-num="04428" class="">King</st> <st data-num="07346" class="">Rehoboam</st> <st data-num="06213" class="">made</st> <st data-num="05178" class="">bronze</st> <st data-num="04043" class="">shields</st> to <st data-num="08478" class="">replace</st> them and <st data-num="06485" class="">assigned</st> them <st data-num="05921 03027">to</st> the <st data-num="08269" class="">officers</st> of the <st data-num="07323" class="">royal guard</st><n id="1" /> who <st data-num="08104" class="">protected</st> the <st data-num="06607" class="">entrance</st> to the <st data-num="04428" class="">royal</st> <st data-num="01004" class="">palace</st>.
Whenever the king visited the Lord’s temple, the royal guard carried them and then brought them back to the guardroom.
The rest of the events of Rehoboam’s reign, including his accomplishments, are recorded in the scroll called the Annals of the Kings of Judah.

<st data-num="07346" class="">Rehoboam</st> and <st data-num="03379" class="">Jeroboam</st> <st data-num="01961" class="">were</st> <st data-num="03605 03117">continually</st> at <st data-num="04421" class="">war</st> <st data-num="0996" class="">with each</st> <st data-num="0996" class="">other</st>.
Rehoboam passed away and was buried with his ancestors in the City of David. His mother was an Ammonite named Naamah. His son Abijah replaced him as king.
